[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯莱克地貌名称，或住所名称，来源于北方中世纪英语，含义是“浅谷”(shallow valley)
[人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 斯莱克绰号，游手好闲者，来源于中世纪英语，含义是“懒惰的”(lazy)

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词均含"松驰的"之意。
means: loose ： 常用，通俗。指人的精神或东西的松驰。
slack ： 强调缺乏牢固性或稳固性，不坚定。

sentence.Network_en: He just gazed at me slack-jawed.
sentence.Network_cn: 他张大了嘴巴，吃惊地盯着我。

sentence.Network_en: Many publishers have simply become far too slack.
sentence.Network_cn: 许多出版商就是变得过于懈怠了。

jx.jx_cn_mean: (北美，非正式)允许某人行为有些余地

lj.lj_ly: as domestic demand starts to flag, foreign demand will help pick up the slack.
lj.lj_ls: 由于国内需求开始萎缩，外贸需求将有助弥补损失。

jx.jx_en_mean: pull on the loose end or part of a rope in order to make it taut
To decrease in activity or intensity.
jx.jx_cn_mean: 放松，缓和：在活动或紧张方面下降

derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English slæc 'inclined to be lazy, unhurried', of Germanic origin; related to Latin laxus 'loose'
late Middle English: probably from Low German or Dutch

entry.def: Something that is slack is loose and not firmly stretched or tightly in position.

entry.tran: 萧条的;清淡的;不景气的
entry.def: A slack period is one in which there is not much work or activity.

example.ex: The workload can be evened out, instead of the shop having busy times and slack periods.
example.tran: 商其工作量可以平均开来，不像商店那样有时很忙，有时很闲。

entry.def: Someone who is slack in their work does not do it properly.

example.ex: Many publishers have simply become far too slack.
example.tran: 许多出版商就是变得过于懈怠了。

entry.def: If someone is slacking, they are not working as hard as they should.

example.ex: He had never let a foreman see him slacking.
example.tran: 他从未在哪个工头面前表现出丝毫懈怠。

entry.tran: 接手他人不再做的工作;补位提供
entry.def: To take up the slack or pick up the slack means to do or provide something that another person or organization is no longer doing or providing.

example.ex: As major airlines give up less-traveled routes, smaller planes are picking up the slack.
example.tran: 由于大型航空公司放弃了乘客较少的路线，一些较小的飞机正在加紧补位。

means.word_mean: 1. dust consisting of a mixture of small coal fragments and coal dust and dirt that sifts out when coal is passed over a sieve
2. a noticeable deterioration in performance or quality;
3. a stretch of water without current or movement;
4. the condition of being loose (not taut);

sentences.sentence: "he hadn't counted on the slackness of the rope"

means.word_mean: 5. a cord or rope or cable that is hanging loosely;
1. avoid responsibilities and work, be idle
2. be inattentive to, or neglect;
3. release tension on;
4. make less active or fast;

sentences.sentence: "He slackened his pace as he got tired"

means.word_mean: 5. become slow or slower;
6. make less active or intense
7. become less in amount or intensity;

sentences.sentence: "The rain let up after a few hours"

means.word_mean: 8. cause to heat and crumble by treatment with water;
1. not tense or taut;

sentences.sentence: "the old man's skin hung loose and gray"

means.word_mean: 2. lacking in strength or firmness or resilience;

sentences.sentence: "a limp gesture as if waving away all desire to know" G.K.Chesterton

means.word_mean: 3. flowing with little speed as e.g. at the turning of the tide;
4. lacking in rigor or strictness;

sentences.sentence: "such lax and slipshod ways are no longer acceptable"

auth_sentence.content: The coaches don't really cut us any slack.

means.word_mean: 松(弛)的

sentences.en: He tightened a few slack screws.
sentences.cn: 他旋紧了几只松动的螺丝。

sentences.en: Discipline in Mr.Brown's class becomes very slack.
sentences.cn: 在布朗先生的班上纪律很松。

means.word_mean: 清淡的, 不活跃的;萧条的；冷清的；清淡的

sentences.en: Winter is the slack season at most hotels.
sentences.cn: 对大多数旅馆来说, 冬天是淡季。

means.word_mean: 懈怠的, 马虎的,不用心的；敷衍了事的；吊儿郎当的

sentences.en: Living alone, he became slack about his appearance.
sentences.cn: 由于单独过活, 他对自己的外表越来越不在意了。

sentences.en: He is always slack in doing his homework.
sentences.cn: 他做作业总是马马虎虎。

means.word_mean: 懈怠；怠惰；偷懒

sentences.en: Haas slacked off in his work.

means.word_mean: 减速;松懈；放松；懈怠

sentences.cn: 他的步速逐渐慢了下来。

sentences.en: Slack the rope before trying to untie the knot.
sentences.cn: 解结之前先将绳索放松。

means.word_mean: (绳索等)松弛部分

sentences.en: He pulled in the slack of the rope.

means.word_mean: 宽松裤

sentences.en: I put on a pair of golfing slacks.
sentences.cn: 我穿上了一条高尔夫球宽松裤。
